text: Half our time is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

text: If there are no dogs in Heaven, then when I die I want to go where they went.
author: Will Rogers

text: Too many people spend money they haven't earned, to buy things they don't want, to impress people that they don't like.
author: Will Rogers

text: Pain is such an uncomfortable feeling that even a tiny amount of it is enough to ruin every enjoyment.
author: Will Rogers

text: Everybody is ignorant, only on different subjects.
author: Will Rogers

text: Don't let yesterday use up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Judgement comes from experience, and experience comes from bad judgement.
author: Will Rogers

text: Golf is good for the soul. You get so mad at yourself you forget to hate your enemies.
author: Will Rogers

text: Everything is changing. People are taking their comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.
author: Will Rogers

text: Being a hero is about the shortest lived profession on earth.
author: Will Rogers

text: The main thing about being a hero is to know when to die.
author: Will Rogers

text: People that pay for things never complain. It's the guy you give something to that you can't please.
author: Will Rogers

text: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
author: Will Rogers

text: The theater is a great equalizer: it is the only place where the poor can look down on the rich.
author: Will Rogers

text: Rumor travels faster, but it don't stay put as long as truth.
author: Will Rogers

text: The only time people dislike gossip is when you gossip about them.
author: Will Rogers

text: Lettin' the cat outta the bag is a whole lot easier 'n puttin' it back in.
author: Will Rogers

text: Whoever said a horse was dumb, was dumb.
author: Will Rogers

text: One revolution is like one cocktail, it just gets you organized for the next.
author: Will Rogers

text: A remark generally hurts in proportion to its truth.
author: Will Rogers

text: Liberty doesn't work as well in practice as it does in speeches.
author: Will Rogers

text: One ad is worth more to a paper than forty editorials.
author: Will Rogers

text: The movies are the only business where you can go out front and applaud yourself.
author: Will Rogers

text: Many only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.
author: Will Rogers

text: On account of being a democracy and run by the people, we are the only nation in the world that has to keep a government four years, no matter what it does.
author: Will Rogers

text: Even if you are on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: I know worrying works, because none of the stuff I worried about ever happened.
author: Will Rogers

text: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.
author: Will Rogers

text: An onion can make people cry, but there has never been a vegetable invented to make them laugh.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you want to be successful, it's just this simple. Know what you are doing. Love what you are doing. And believe in what you are doing.
author: Will Rogers

text: The road to success is dotted with many tempting parking spaces.
author: Will Rogers

text: Even if you are on the right track, you will get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: In a real estate man's eye, the most expensive part of the city is where he has a house to sell.
author: Will Rogers

text: Never let yesterday use up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: America is a great country, but you can't live in it for nothing.
author: Will Rogers

text: An onion can make people cry but there's never been a vegetable that can make people laugh.
author: Will Rogers

text: I am just an old country boy in a big town trying to get along. I have been eating pretty regular and the reason I have been is because I have stayed an old country boy.
author: Will Rogers

text: Man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.
author: Will Rogers

text: The quickest way to double your money is to fold it in half and put it in your back pocket.
author: Will Rogers

text: Something that seems funny when it happens to someone else, may not seem so funny when it happens to us.
author: Will Rogers

text: There is something about riding down the street on a prancing horse that makes you feel like something, even when you ain't a thing.
author: Will Rogers

text: Make crime pay. Become a lawyer.
author: Will Rogers

text: The minute you read something that you can't understand, you can almost be sure that it was drawn up by a lawyer.
author: Will Rogers

text: Our country has plenty of five-cent cigars, but the trouble is they charge fifteen cents for them.
author: Will Rogers

text: The income tax has made more liars out of the American people than golf has. Even when you make a tax form out on the level, you don't know when it's through if you are a crook or a martyr.
author: Will Rogers

text: It is a good thing that we do not get as much government as we pay for.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you make any money, the government shoves you in the creek once a year with it in your pockets, and all that don't get wet you can keep.
author: Will Rogers

text: Don't gamble; take all your savings and buy some good stock and hold it till it goes up, then sell it. If it don't go up, don't buy it.
author: Will Rogers

text: People who fly into a rage always make a bad landing.
author: Will Rogers

text: The best way out of a difficulty is through it.
author: Will Rogers

text: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
author: Will Rogers

text: I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts.
author: Will Rogers

text: When everybody has got money they cut taxes, and when they're broke they raise 'em. That's statesmanship of the highest order.
author: Will Rogers

text: Communism is like prohibition, it is a good idea, but it won't work.
author: Will Rogers

text: Popularity is the easiest thing in the world to gain and it is the hardest thing to hold
author: Will Rogers

text: Prohibition is better than no liquor at all.
author: Will Rogers

text: The best doctor in the world is the veterinarian. They can't ask their patients what is the matter - they've got to just know.
author: Will Rogers

text: The budget is a mythical bean bag. Congress votes mythical beans into it, and then tries to reach in and pull real beans out.
author: Will Rogers

text: One way to solve the traffic problem is to keep all the cars that are not paid for off the streets.
author: Will Rogers

text: There's a simple solution to our traffic problems. We'll have business build the roads, and government build the cars.
author: Will Rogers

text: Outside of traffic, there is nothing that has held this country back as much as committees.
author: Will Rogers

text: In time of crisis people want to know that you care, more than they care what you know
author: Will Rogers

text: We will never have true civilization until we have learned to recognize the rights of others.
author: Will Rogers

text: A debt is just as hard for a Government to pay as it is for an individual. No debt ever comes due at a good time. Borrowing is the only thing that seems handy all the time.
author: Will Rogers

text: Polo, racing and horse shows all are doing great work to help the farmer and rancher to raise better horses.
author: Will Rogers

text: A difference of opinion is what makes horse racing and missionaries.
author: Will Rogers

text: When you are satisfied, you are successful. For that's all there is to success is satisfaction.
author: Will Rogers

text: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

text: Democrats never agree on anything, that's why they're Democrats. If they agreed with each other, they would be Republicans.
author: Will Rogers

text: Every day you meet a delegation going to some convention to try and change the way of somebody else's life.
author: Will Rogers

text: Buy land. They ain't making any more of the stuff.
author: Will Rogers

text: Too many people spend money they haven't earned to buy things they don't want to impress people they don't like.
author: Will Rogers

text: Everything is changing. People are taking the comedians seriously and the politicians as a joke.
author: Will Rogers

text: Never miss a good chance to shut up.
author: Will Rogers

text: The fellow that can only see a week ahead is always the popular fellow, for he is looking with the crowd. But the one that can see years ahead, he has a telescope but he can't make anybody believe that he has it.
author: Will Rogers

text: We are always yapping about the 'Good Old Days' and how we look back and enjoy it, but I tell you there is a lot of hooey to it. There is a whole lot of all our past lives that wasn't so hot.
author: Will Rogers

text: In Hollywood the woods are full of people that learned to write but evidently can't read. If they could read their stuff, they'd stop writing.
author: Will Rogers

text: In Hollywood you can see things at night that are fast enough to be in the Olympics in the day time.
author: Will Rogers

text: A conference is just an admission that you want somebody to join you in your troubles.
author: Will Rogers

text: Spinnin' a rope is fun if your neck ain't in it
author: Will Rogers

text: We always want the best man to win an election. Unfortunately, he never runs.
author: Will Rogers

text: Every Harvard class should have one Democrat to rescue it from oblivion
author: Will Rogers

text: Even when you make a tax form out on the level, you do not know when it is through if you are a crook or a martyr.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you feel the urge, don't be afraid to go on a wild goose chase.
author: Will Rogers

text: If you make any money, the government shoves you in the creek once a year with it in your pockets, and all that don't get wet you can keep..
author: Will Rogers

text: You never know how much a man can't remember until he is called as a witness.
author: Will Rogers

text: There is something about riding on a prancing horse that makes you feel like something, even when you aint worth a thing
author: Will Rogers

text: If this depression stays with us, the loser Tuesday is going to be the winner.
author: Will Rogers

text: Eventually you reach a point when you stop lying about your age and start bragging about it.
author: Will Rogers

text: Even if you’re on the right track, you’ll get run over if you just sit there.
author: Will Rogers

text: We don't give our criminals much punishment, but we sure give 'em plenty of publicity.
author: Will Rogers

text: When I die, I want to die like my grandfather who died peacefully in his sleep. Not screaming like all the passengers in his car.
author: Will Rogers

text: Hawaii is the only place I know where they lay flowers on you while you are alive.
author: Will Rogers

text: Hawaii is the only place I know where they lay flowers on you while you are alive. Hawaii is the only place I know where they lay flowers on you while you are alive.
author: Will Rogers

text: There are two things that can disrupt business in this country. One is War, and the other is a meeting of the Federal Reserve Bank.
author: Will Rogers

text: There are two things that I don't care how smart you are, you will never understand. One is an alienist's testimony and the other is a railroad timetable.
author: Will Rogers

text: Steak on the plate went up. Steak on the hoof went down.
author: Will Rogers

text: I would rather be the man who bought the Brooklyn Bridge than the man who sold it.
author: Will Rogers

text: Too many people spend money they earned..to buy things they don't want..to impress people that they don't like.
author: Will Rogers

text: There's two theories to arguing with a woman. Neither works.
author: Will Rogers

text: It's hard to tell whether there is more guns or flowers at a gangster's funeral. I would rather have the undertaker's privilege with some high-class gang, than to have a seat on the Stock Exchange.
author: Will Rogers

text: Personally I have always felt that the best doctor in the world is the veterinarian. He can't ask his patients what's the matter—He's got to just know.
author: Will Rogers

text: Political elections... are a good deal like marriages, there's no accounting for anyone's taste.
author: Will Rogers

text: I don't think you can make a lawyer honest by an act of legislature. You've got to work on his conscience. And his lack of conscience is what makes him a lawyer.
author: Will Rogers

text: Being young is beautiful, but being old is comfortable.
author: Will Rogers

text: Half of our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

text: Eventually, you will reach a point when you stop lying about your age and start bragging about it.
author: Will Rogers

text: The schools ain't what they used to be and never was.
author: Will Rogers

text: The business of government is to keep the government out of business - that is, unless business needs government aid.
author: Will Rogers

text: During Prohibition, it was said tailors would ask customers what size pockets they wanted, pint or quart.
author: Will Rogers

text: A holding company is the people you give your money to while you are being searched.
author: Will Rogers

text: Common sense ain't common.
author: Will Rogers

text: Live in such a way that you would not be ashamed to sell your parrot to the town gossip.
author: Will Rogers
